Title: The Pleasure of His Company
Writer: Cornelia Otis Skinner (play), Samuel A. Taylor (play), Samuel A. Taylor (screenplay)
Actors: Fred Astaire, Debbie Reynolds, Lilli Palmer, Tab Hunter
Plot: San Francisco debutante, Jessica Poole, is marrying Napa Valley cattle rancher, Roger Henderson, and hopes her peripatetic father, "Pogo" Poole, whom she hasn't seen for years, comes to the wedding. He arrives, disrupting the household of his ex-wife, Katharine, and her long-suffering husband, and befriending their cook, Toy. At first it seems that Pogo is set on breaking up the engagement, making up for years of neglect by wining and dining Jessica, showing up Roger as a hick, and enticing her to come to Europe with him. Then it seems his real goal is to win back Katharine's heart: why else would he have two tickets to Paris booked on a plane leaving right after the reception?
Awards: Nominated for 1 Golden Globe. Another 1 nomination.
